properties.name: Berlin Kids International School
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing  Weinstraße 1 10249 Berlin, GermanyTuition: €165 per month base tuition, or €185 per month for families with a net income of €40,000 or over. Four places per class are reserved for children from socially dis-advantaged circumstances at a fee of €85.50 per month.

properties.name: Dense ( Berlin, DE )
properties.description: Posted by DsudorionDense Promotion Reichenberger Str. 147 10999 Berlin Germany Dense Promotion is a Berlin-based music promotion Company run by Erik Ed Benndorf. Founded in December 2000 by Ed Benndorf and Annibale Picicci Dense Promotion assists labels from all over the world in promoting their releases in Europe. Dense has specialized its promotion services to fit especially the needs of independent labels and artists releasing experimental electronic music More than 50 labels trust their knowledge, experience and dedication. >>> to get a better impression please check clients on the site. Dense Promotion can rely on their specialized network of key press contacts in international print media, on the web and on air. Dense ensures efficient and professional media coverage for quality productions. Dense also has a weekly radio show on Hamburg\'s TIDE 96.0. Find the playlists of TIGHT FM here.

properties.name: Food
properties.description: Posted by ErikThere are some down-market food stores here.

properties.name: Forckenberger Park
properties.description: Posted by ErikSix or seven flavors of awesome. My favorite might be the Abenteuer Kinderspielplatz at the north east end. A playground with a 50-foot high tree house where they play with fire. Yes, real live FIRE. It\'s for kids from 6 to 14. There are a couple of adults -- 23-year-old dreadlocked adults -- on hand to make sure there aren\'t too many deaths. The sign says "This place is dangerous. Don\'t let your kids in if you can\'t handle that."

properties.name: InterKULTURelles Haus Pankow
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing      Schönfließer Straße 7, 10439 Berlin, GermanyThis place is just great. I\'m taking a wonderful intensive German class here for really cheap through OASE. There\'s a cafe here where you can get a sandwich and a drink for 1 Euro.

properties.name: Iris' Residence
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing Dessau, Germanynice! Humperdinckstr. 28, 06844 Dessau

properties.name: Künstlerhaus Celeste
properties.description: Posted by ErikOne of the many places that have more or less open artists studios that almost anybody can use for very cheap or free. It\'s in a cool old brewery or something. How awesome is that?!

properties.name: Legoland Discovery Center
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishingThis place looks fun!

properties.name: Mr. Dead & Mrs. Free (Berlin, DE )
properties.description: Posted by Dsudorion Here you\'ll find especially indie music, CD and vinyl, specialised shop, so not really cheap. You can buy concerttickets here Verkopen voornamelijk indiezaken. Zowel cd\'s als vinyl. Gewoon alles wat ze zelf goed vinden, denk ik. Omdat het een tamelijk gespecialiseerde zaak is, zul je niet zo snel echte koopjes vinden, maar soms wel dingen die je ergens anders niet altijd vindt. Je kan er ook dingen bestellen, en je kan er ook terecht om concerttickets in voorverkoop te kopen voor de meeste concerten(en ze vragen minder Gebühr dan bv. de KoKa36).

properties.name: Old abattoirs
properties.description: Posted by ErikSlow urban renewal. Townhouses. Lots of vacant lots. A few ruins still.

properties.name: SEZ
properties.description: Posted by ErikOK, it\'s a shame to be starting to add places to the area around the first decent aptartment with one of the saddest stories around here, the Sport- und Erlebnis-Zentrum. This crazy UFO of a structure was home to a bunch of swimming pools, bars, and ice rinks up until 2002, when it shut down for what looks like a pretty open-ended renovation. When the SEZ comes back to life, we will all be very awesomely served by its multitiered awesomeness. As of now, the Bowling Alley is open!

properties.name: Saint Georges Bookshop
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishingWorther Strasse 27, 10405 BerlinEnglish-language book shop

properties.name: Tacheles
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing   oranienburgerstr 54, Berlin, GermanyWhen I was in Berlin for about a month in 1995, this was one of the places I hung out. At that time it was a fairrly gritty squat. I hear it\'s all legit now. There is a pretty interesting Wikipedia article about it.

properties.name: Volkspark F
properties.description: Posted by ErikAwesome. Skateparks, climbing structure, cool restaurant, fountains, rollerblading track, bunkers, ponds... What more could one want!
